;;周二（10 月 10 日），数百名示威者在布达佩斯多瑙河沿岸点燃蜡烛，声援以色列，此前周末哈马斯发动了史无前例的袭击，造成 1000 多名以色列人死亡。;
;

;以色列誓言通过地面攻势升级对巴勒斯坦激进组织哈马斯袭击的回应，而美国总统乔·拜登则承诺支持以色列;并向任何可能寻求利用这一局势的人发出警告;。

;

;以色列表示，周三夜间，数十架战斗机袭击了 200 多个目标。据称，哈马斯利用该地区发动了前所未有的袭击。

;

;加沙卫生部表示，在这个拥挤的沿海飞地，至少有 950 人死亡，5,000 人受伤。

;

; >;

;周六，来自加沙地带的哈马斯枪手在以色列南部部分地区的;以色列历史上最致命的巴勒斯坦武装分子袭击;。

;

;以色列军方表示，以色列境内死亡人数已达1,200人，超过2,700人受伤。

;

;军方发言人乔纳森·康里克斯中校在 X（前身为 Twitter）上的视频简报中表示，“我们遭受了极其严重的伤亡”。

;

;受害者绝大多数是被枪杀的平民;在家中;、街道上或户外舞会上。数十名以色列人和其他海外人士;被抓获;并被带到加沙作为人质，社交媒体上显示一些人被游街示众。

;

;哈马斯武装分子周一扣押以色列士兵和平民作为人质，威胁要处决一名以色列人。加沙的每一栋房屋都在没有警告的情况下遭到袭击，但随着周二夜幕降临，没有迹象表明他们这样做了。

;

;以色列国防部长约夫·加兰特在加沙围栏附近对士兵说：“哈马斯想要改变，它就会得到改变。加沙的情况将不再存在。”

;

;“我们从空中开始进攻，稍后我们也会从地面进攻。我们一直在控制从第二天起，我们就开始进攻该地区。进攻只会愈演愈烈。”

;

;据以色列 Hayom 报纸报道，至少 1,000 名从加沙渗透的枪手已被击毙。

;

;以色列在占领加沙 38 年之后于 2005 年从加沙撤军，并自哈马斯 2007 年夺取加沙政权以来一直对其进行封锁。以色列周一宣布的围困将阻止粮食和燃料的供应。

;

;关于以色列三名安全消息人士称，在北部边境，黎巴嫩南部向以色列发射了一系列火箭弹，引发以色列炮击。

;

;更多 ;从叙利亚领土发射的炮弹;落在以色列的空旷地区，进一步引发人们对暴力事件可能导致以色列更广泛的战争。

;

;“我们还不知道这些火箭是否是叙利亚武装部队、现有并受到叙利亚政权欢迎的众多伊朗民兵中的任何一个发射的，还是真主党或任何其他行动”，以色列中校康里库斯说道。

;

;“我们所知道的是，我们向火源进行了报复性开火，目前那里的局势平静。”

;

;警报器警告夜间，火箭弹袭击了加沙边境附近的以色列社区。;

;在白宫，拜登称哈马斯的袭击为;“纯粹的邪恶行为;”，并表示华盛顿正在紧急向以色列提供更多军事援助，包括补充铁穹防空系统的弹药和拦截器。他呼吁以色列在回应中遵循“战争法”。

;

;他告诉记者，美国“增强了我们在该地区的军事力量态势，以加强我们的威慑”，包括通过移动;航母打击群;和战斗机。

;

;拜登说：“让我再次对任何国家、任何组织、任何想利用这一局势的人说，我有一个词：不要。”这显然是指伊朗及其在该地区的代理人。

;

;美国官员表示，他们没有证据表明伊朗策划了这些袭击，但指出伊朗长期支持哈马斯。

;

;哈马斯前领导人哈立德·梅沙尔周五呼吁阿拉伯世界举行抗议活动。路透社看到的一份记录声明中表达了对巴勒斯坦人的支持。

;

;“[我们必须]在星期五，即阿克萨洪水星期五，前往阿拉伯和伊斯兰世界的广场和街道，”梅沙尔说现任哈马斯侨民办公室领导人。

;

;拜登派遣其高级外交官安东尼·布林肯前往以色列，美国国务院发言人马修·米勒表示，他将传递“团结和支持的信息”。

; >;

;美国国家安全顾问杰克·沙利文表示，华盛顿还在与以色列和埃及讨论为平民离开加沙建立安全通道的想法。

;

;以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡的右翼联盟和反对派领导人即将;组建紧急联合政府;。

;

;包括;斐济;在内的国家/地区、;韩国;、;丹麦;，;捷克共和国;和;加拿大;紧急撤离公民，许多人在主要航空公司取消航班后滞留。

;

;巴勒斯坦媒体称，以色列空袭袭击了加沙市、南部城市汗尤尼斯和加沙中部的布赖吉难民营。

;

;被袭击的一处房屋属于;穆罕默德·德伊夫;，加沙哈马斯武装派别领导人，报道称。据报道，Deif 的兄弟和其他家庭成员被杀。

;

;在社交媒体上求助的居民表示，许多建筑物倒塌，有时多达 50 人被困在里面，救援人员无法到达他们。

;

;联合国表示，超过 18 万加沙人无家可归，许多人挤在街道上或学校里。

;

;在加沙汗尤尼斯医院的太平间，尸体躺在地上。担架上写着他们的名字。医务人员呼吁亲属尽快收拾尸体，因为没有更多空间容纳死者。

;

;一栋用作紧急避难所的市政大楼遭到袭击。那里的幸存者谈到许多人死亡。

;

;";加沙没有一个地方是安全的;，正如你所看到的，他们袭击了所有地方，”35 岁的阿拉·阿布·泰尔 (Ala Abu Tair) 说，他在逃离边境附近的阿巴桑·卡比拉 (Abassan Al-Kabira) 后与家人一起在那里寻求庇护.

;

;哈马斯官员称，哈马斯政治办公室的两名成员贾瓦德·阿布·沙马拉和扎卡里亚·阿布·马马尔在汗尤尼斯的一次空袭中丧生。

;

;巴勒斯坦外交部表示，自周六以来，以色列的袭击摧毁了 22,600 多个住宅单位和 10 个医疗设施，并损坏了 48 所学校。

;

;“如此公然的非人化行为，并试图用轰炸手段迫使人民屈服，以饥饿作为战争手段，路透社看到，巴勒斯坦联合国特使里亚德·曼苏尔周二在给联合国安理会的一封信中写道，并消除他们的民族存在无异于种族灭绝。

;

;联合国人权事务高级专员;沃尔克·特克;谴责哈马斯袭击，他说： “国际人道法很明确：在整个袭击过程中，始终注意保护平民和民用物体免受伤害的义务仍然适用。”

;

;被占领的约旦河西岸和东耶路撒冷也爆发了暴力事件，以色列人在那里警方表示，周二晚上，两名向警察发射烟花的巴勒斯坦人被杀。

;

;据巴勒斯坦卫生部称，自周六以来，在约旦河西岸，已有 21 名巴勒斯坦人在与以色列军队的冲突中丧生，130 人受伤。

;斐济国防部长表示，斐济航空的一架航班载着近 200 名斐济宗教朝圣者以及澳大利亚公民离开特拉维夫，机上有新西兰、加拿大和美国。

;

;国防部长皮奥·蒂科杜阿杜瓦 (Pio Tikoduadua) 在苏瓦对记者表示，该航班将于周四抵达斐济楠迪，并赞扬机组人员“选择飞往两周前，斐济航空公司首次飞往特拉维夫，载着大批基督教朝圣者，这个太平洋岛国在承诺与以色列建立更密切的关系后，寻求与以色列建立更密切的关系。明年开设大使馆。

;

;多家国际航空公司已;暂停飞往特拉维夫的航班服务，影响了数百个航班。

;

;斐济航空 2394 号专机于 2019 年 12 月降落在本古里安机场蒂科杜阿杜瓦在周三的新闻发布会上表示，周二“执行将斐济人带回家的任务”，并已安全离开。

;

;飞机上还有国际旅客，包括 13 名澳大利亚人、16 名新西兰人、8 名萨摩亚人、他说，还有几名美国人、加拿大人和菲律宾人。

;

;这位部长还表示，尚未就斐济驻以色列使团的所在地做出决定，这似乎背离了斐济在以色列的承诺。副总理比尔·加沃卡 (Bill Gavoka) 表示，将在耶路撒冷开设大使馆。

;

;“关于大使馆的地点和设立时间，目前仍在规划过程中。显然，鉴于现在的情况，人们会担心如何安全地进行，”Tikoduadua 说。

;

;上个月，太平洋岛屿邻国巴布亚新几内亚 (PNG) 在耶路撒冷开设了大使馆，成为第五个大使馆。一个在其地位是中东最敏感问题之一的城市拥有正式外交使团的国家。

;飓风莉迪亚于周二晚间以“极其危险的风暴”形式袭击了墨西哥太平洋海岸，带来了强风和猛雨并造成至少一人死亡，不过在向内陆猛冲时强度已减弱为 2 级风暴。

;

;纳亚里特州当局表示，一名男子在他向北行驶的货车上被一棵树压死。巴亚尔塔港的主要旅游目的地。

;

;莉迪亚于下午 6 点（格林威治标准时间 0000）之前在海滩小镇拉斯佩尼塔斯登陆，风暴强度为 4 级。

;

;在巴亚尔塔港，居民用木板封住窗户，并从海滩上拖出一袋袋沙子，以加固店面的防洪屏障，机场表示将关闭至周三上午 8 点（格林尼治标准时间 1400 点）。

;

;这座城市的街道空无一人。夜幕降临时，强风将海水吹过棕榈树成荫的海滨长廊，震动了建筑物。

;

;到晚上 9 点（格林威治标准时间 0300），美国国家飓风中心 (NHC) 表示，莉迪亚的最大持续风力为 105 级英里/小时（165 公里/小时），当时它经过哈利斯科州内陆城镇马斯科塔附近。

;

;总部位于迈阿密的 NHC 表示，莉迪亚正以 17 英里/小时（28 公里/小时）的速度向东北方向移动，并且应该会很快减弱。飓风在墨西哥中西部的高地上移动。

;

;

;Authorities in the state of Nayarit said a person was killed when a tree fell on the van he was driving north of the major tourist destination of Puerto Vallarta.

;

;In Puerto Vallarta, residents boarded up windows and dragged sacks of sand from the beach to reinforce flood barriers on their storefronts, and the airport said it would shut down until 8 am (1400 GMT) on Wednesday.

;

;The city's streets were empty by nightfall, as strong winds hurled water across its palm-lined promenade and shook buildings.

;

;The US National Hurricane Center ( NHC) said Lidia was of "extremely dangerous" strength and blowing maximum sustained winds of 140 mph (225 kph) in the state of Jalisco.

;

;"I urge people living between Nayarit and Jalisco, especially in Bahia de Banderas, Puerto Vallarta and Tomatlan, to take precautions," President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on social media platform X, formerly known as Twitter, telling people to stay away from low-lying areas, rivers and slopes.

;

;Social media videos showed heavy rain as far as the inland city of Guadalajara. Some people reported fallen trees blocking roads and rivers threatening to burst their banks.

;

;The Miami-based NHC said Lidia was moving east-northeast at 16 mph (26 kph) and should weaken quickly as it barrels inland.

;

;A hurricane warning is in effect from the Islas Marias to the inland town of El Roblito in Nayarit state to the port city of Manzanillo, while tropical storm conditions could extend as far as Michoacan state and southern parts of Sinaloa.

;

;Lidia is expected to dump up to 8 inches (20 cm) of rain, though some areas could see up to 12 inches through Wednesday, the NHC said.

;

;Farther south, Tropical Storm Max killed two people and injured at least two in the state of Guerrero, according to media reports.

;

;Lidia comes eight years after Patricia, a Category 5 hurricane - the highest level on the Saffir-Simpson scale - struck close to Puerto Vallarta with winds that tore down trees, moved cars and forced thousands of people to flee from their homes.

; Wed, 11 Oct 2023 10:25:04 +0800 “Shameful“: OAS accuses Guatemala prosecutors of election interferencehttps://reuters.com/article/guatemala-politics/shameful-oas-accuses-guatemala-prosecutors-of-election-interference-idUSKBN31B021
;;2023-10-11T00:54:34Z;
;

;Guatemalan prosecutors are seeking to block the landslide winner of the country's presidential election from taking office, the head of the Organization of American States (OAS) said Tuesday, denouncing the push as a "shameful example for the hemisphere."

;

;Luis Almagro, the chief of the Washington-based OAS, called the ongoing investigation by the Guatemalan Attorney General's Office into the party of President-elect Bernardo Arevalo and the electoral authority an unprecedented attack on Guatemala's democracy.

;

;Running on an anti-corruption platform, Arevalo won the August run-off with a 20-point margin of victory.

;

;Since last week, tens of thousands of Guatemalans have taken to the streets to protest what many have called a slow-motion coup, while demanding the resignation of Attorney General Consuelo Porras and other judicial officials collaborating with her inquiries.

;

;"The prosecutors' office has chosen to ignore numerous calls from the international community and its behavior violates democratic norms," Almagro said.

;

;"It continues to take measures that appear to be designed to override the will of the electorate," he added.

;

;Porras' office did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

;

;In the past, her office has justified its raids on Arevalo's Semilla party and the electoral body as necessary for lawful investigations into alleged irregularities during the election, especially claims that Semilla's registration six years ago was tainted by falsified signatures.

;

;Isolated violent incidents were reported on Monday, which have since led to some banks, schools, supermarkets and restaurant chains, including McDonald's, to temporarily close.

;

;Overall, the protests have been largely peaceful.

;

;Arevalo described the violent incidents as caused by "hit groups" looking to destabilize the protests.

;

;Outgoing President Alejandro Giammattei has called the demonstrations illegal and warned that organizers - whom he accused of receiving funds from abroad - would be arrested.

;

;Giammattei's office, in the run-up to the August vote, said it respected the autonomy of the government powers and that it would not interfere with judicial processes. The president has not publicly questioned Porras' investigations.

;

;A Colorado prosecutor on Tuesday told jurors in closing arguments that two officers charged with manslaughter in the killing of Elijah McClain repeatedly and ;unreasonably assaulted; the young Black man who died after a police stop in 2019.

;

;Defense attorneys, though, argued others were to blame, including medical responders and even McClain himself. They argued that prosecutors only brought the case because of political pressure following the George Floyd protests.

;

;The case is now in the hands of the jury.

;

;Prosecutor Duane Lyons told jurors the officers made no attempt to moderate their encounter with McClain as their training dictated. Officers Randy Roedema and Jason Rosenblatt are charged with reckless manslaughter and second-degree assault.

;

;"They chose to see violence where there was none," Lyons said. “他们选择使用暴力，而不是缓和局势。”

;

;里昂向陪审员展示了警察对 ;McClain，23;。

;

;“这么说只是轻视那天晚上发生的事情将是一场悲剧，”莱昂斯补充道。 “被告有罪。”

;

;但是Roedema的辩护律师唐·西森(Don Sisson)在结案陈词中将体重140磅的麦克莱恩描述为暴力抵抗警察，并称这证明了他们的反应是正当的。他说，当警察将麦克莱恩的控制权交给护理人员时，麦克莱恩仍然活着并且反应灵敏，并且医务人员全权负责注射;致命剂量的氯胺酮;。

;

;“发生悲剧并不意味着存在犯罪行为， “西森告诉陪审员。 "You cannot use your emotion to guide your decision."

;

;In the first of three trials in the McClain case, prosecutors have argued that officers Roedema and Rosenblatt unnecessarily brutalized McClain when they stopped him and that they gave false and incomplete information to paramedics which contributed to the medical workers administering a large dose of the sedative ketamine.

;

;Defense attorneys argued it was the ketamine that killed McClain, and that paramedics were solely responsible.

;

;A revised autopsy report in September 2022 concluded McClain died from "complications of ketamine administration following forcible restraint."

;

;A bystander had called 911 to report that McClain was acting suspiciously as he walked home from a convenience store on Aug. 24, 2019, in the Denver suburb of Aurora. McClain, dressed in a winter coat and face mask on a warm night, was listening to music using ear buds and dancing slightly as he walked, security videos showed.

;

;Rosenblatt, Roedema and a third Aurora police officer arrived and grabbed McClain nine seconds after confronting him, according to body camera footage showed by prosecutors. A struggle ensued.

;

;The footage does not show McClain grabbing for a gun, but Roedema can be heard yelling that McClain tried to get Rosenblatt's weapon. Harvey Steinberg, Rosenblatt's defense attorney, said during closing arguments that it was reasonable for his client to act on that warning. Prosecutors say McClain did not grab for a gun.

;

;The officers put McClain in a "carotid" chokehold at least twice and held him down for 15 minutes until medics arrived.

;

;The episode initially received little media attention. The case gained more notice following the May 2020 killing of Floyd, a Black man who died at the hands of Minneapolis police. Floyd's death sparked international outrage and fueled protests against racial injustice and police brutality.

;

;In the wake of the protests, Colorado Governor Jared Polis ordered the state's attorney general to review the case. Charges were eventually brought in late 2021.

;

;Roedema and Rosenblatt did not take the stand during a joint trial that opened Sept. 20. Roedema was suspended from the Aurora police pending the outcome of the case, while Rosenblatt was dismissed.

;

;The manslaughter trial for the third officer, Nathan Woodyard, is set to open on Friday. Two paramedics are expected to face trial next month.

;;2023-10-11T00:46:55Z;
;

;Hurricane Lidia plowed into Mexico's Pacific coast at the beach town of Las Penitas as a powerful Category 4 storm on Tuesday evening, as local tourist resorts hunkered down to shelter from lashing rains, potentially lethal winds and flooding.

;

;The US National Hurricane Center (NHC) said Lidia was of "extremely dangerous" strength and blowing maximum sustained winds of 140 miles per hour (225 kph) in the state of Jalisco.

;

;"I urge people living between Nayarit and Jalisco, especially in Bahia de Banderas, Puerto Vallarta and Tomatlan, to take precautions," President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on social media platform X, recommending people to stay away from low-lying areas, rivers and slopes.

;

;The Miami-based NHC said Lidia was moving east-northeast at 16 mph (26 kph) and should weaken quickly as it barrels inland.

;

;In Puerto Vallarta, a major nearby tourist destination, the airport announced it was closing until 8 am on Wednesday.

;

;A Hurricane warning is in effect from the Islas Marias to the inland town of El Roblito in Nayarit state to the port city of Manzanillo, while tropical storm conditions could extend as far as Michoacan state and southern parts of Sinaloa.

;

;Lidia was expected to produce between 4-8 inches (10-20 cm) of rainfall, though some areas could see up to 12 inches through Wednesday, the NHC said.

;

;Further south, Tropical Storm Max left two dead and at least two injured in the state of Guerrero following heavy rains, according to local media reports.
